item.title: Wall covered in Graffiti - Commercial Way, 30th December
item.description:
This wall is a long term installation and we don't want it covered in graffiti for the years that it will be there for. Please just cover with black paint as soon as possible before it builds up even more.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bird in Bush Road, Peckham, Greater London

item.title: Flytipping near children’s playground, 30th December
item.description:
Someone is repeatedly flytipping outside my house and a children’s playground. Bags are full of alcohol and other paraphernalia.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 353, Rotherhithe New Road, Bermondsey, Greater London

item.title: Dog fouling, 30th December
item.description:
Regular dog fouling outside property, is requesting for to be cleared up but also a sign to be put up to prevent this going forward JW
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Littlejohn Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside train station, 30th December
item.description:
This metal barrier was struck by a vehicle in November and has been left sticking out at the bottom which poses a trip hazard and the structure is wobbly. Station staff have popped hazard tape around it and we were trying to find out who owned it to repair it. Has been identified that it belongs to the council. Please could I ask for someone to come and make this area safe for the general public

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Lower Station Road, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 x empty boxes of gas canisters dumped on pavement, 30th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitebeam Avenue, Southborough, Greater London

item.title: Light flickering on and off continuously throughout the night, 30th December
item.description:

item.title: Double mattress fly-tipped on Hillcourt Road, 30th December
item.description:
Someone has fly-tipped a double mattress outside #37 Hillcourt Road. It has been obscuring the pavement making it very difficult for the postie trolley and buggies to get past. Please can the council remove immediately. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hillcourt Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Growing pile of fly tipped waste, 30th December
item.description:
Flytipped waste sitting there for a week; people have been adding things so it is growing. I often notice vans coming by late at night and then the next day seeing flytipped waste and furniture lying around our estate. Surely installing some cameras in this specific parking area would solve the problem and likely allow the council to apply some significant fines to the businesses committing these actions.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Millender Walk, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Daily engine idling, 30th December
item.description:
Vehicle is parked outside Turner House (Herrick Street) each evening and remains there until 8am. Driver remains inside the vehicle overnight. Engine idles for sustained periods throughout the night. Issue has been ongoing for a minimum of 1 month.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Herrick Street, Millbank, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet
